page.title: 02Whittington Buildings
page.content: There are several attractive housing estates in Whittington.The oldest is {Penybryn}with 88 semi-detached and terraced council houses{.Western {Avenue}built alongside the Great Western Railway line in the early 1960's is the other council estate. Private estates have since been built at{Rosehill,Yew Tree,Walsham Avenue, {Manor Gardens}and{Cambrian Avenue.}The village school was built in 1966 with an extension in 1974.This replaced an 1853 school which is now the Community Centre.The oldest houses are in Castle and Church Streets with part of the Big House dating to 1631.There used to be Whittington railway stations on the Paddington to Chester line and on the Cambrian Railway which ran from Crewe to Aberystwyth.This line is now closed.
